title: Registration Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lake Health (Mentor, OH)
Interview Descriptions: Would not recommend joining this company until merge is completed. Was told the position was only guaranteed for two years and no one knew what would happen after that. Interview itself was pretty standard.
Interview Questions:
Why did you apply here?
Do you feel qualified?

title: Patient Registration Emergency Department Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lake Health (Willoughby, OH) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: It was a little Lengthy I think do to miss communication. I checked My application status and it said I was sent a link to scheduled next steps into the process, I never received the Link, I called and emailed for about 2 weeks.. Nothing, I then said forget . Almost two months later I was able to speak with someone in HR who gave me a contact information for a recruiter. I emailed the recruiter, the recruiter responded right away, step up a phone interview, I was then passed on to the hiring manager, after about 1 week and a half I spoke with hiring Manager and was offered the job. I just completed my pre-employment task and now waiting to start in about two weeks.
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time when you had to handle a difficult situation? What was the situation? How did you handle the situation? Did you involve anyone ? What was the outcome?

title: Physician Office Coordinator Interview
Interview Descriptions: Very informative. Did two round one with the VP and one with physicians. Spent lots of time getting to know me and answered all questions about organization and the job.
Interview Questions: How would you handle stressful situations.

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lake Health (Cleveland, OH) in Jul 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was first interviewed by HR and then was set up with an interview with the nurse manager, within a weeks time. Given a tour of the unit and met with co-workers. I was then asked to come back and shadow on the unit.  HR got back with me by the end of the week with an offer. Took about 2 weeks for the entire process.
Interview Questions: Typical RN interview questions were asked such as why did you become a nurse; give an example where you had to deal with a difficult patient, coworker and what did you do?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lake Health (Willoughby, OH) in May 2020
Interview Descriptions: It went smoothly. very typical interview processes, simple questions. The environment was quiet, was able to meet with the manager in her private office. Very informal conversation. The manager asked about my educational background, where I see myself, how would I describe myself etc. Very typical interview questions that any other employee would ask. One tough question was this: "why Lakehealth?" I think they ask this question because there are so many other hospitals near Cleveland that they want to know that you are dedicated in working for Lakehealth.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself in 5 years?

title: Front Desk Receptionist Interview
Application Type: The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lake Health in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: I thought the process was very easy, and they where all very helpful, but sometimes some of things where confusing in regards to getting an interview. If you are unsure make sure tot contact them, and they will help you out
Interview Questions: One thing that asked me was, why do I want to work at lake health.

title: Clerk Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 months. I interviewed at Lake Health (Painesville, OH) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: Have to take the same dumb personality assessment for each position you apply for, takes months to get a call for an interview.  Takes weeks after the interview to get a drug test and a physical, takes weeks after drug test and physical to get scheduled for orientation.  Seriously, it takes so long.
Interview Questions: The recruiter asked me to speak about a situation in which I was charitable or philanthropic.

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lake Health (Cleveland, OH) in Aug 2012
Interview Descriptions: Initially, I looked online for available positions at Lake Health in my area.  Applied online and received a phone call within two weeks to come in for an interview.  Appropriate length time frame, open ended questions with a casual, friendly feel.  Interviewer was warm and at ease with conversation.  The interviewer provided me with helpful inforation regarding the department I was interested in such as nurse manager and typical length of stay for employees there.
Interview Questions: "What would you say was one of the most difficult challenges you have had to face in your career and how did you handle it?"

title: Case Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Lake Health (Concord Township, OH) in May 2012
Interview Descriptions: Had 4 seperate interviews. Thought for sure I had the job but then waited almost 3 weeks after the final interview before hearing anything at all. I called HR to inquire as to how soon the decision might be made only to get attitude from the HR staff. Supposedly I had been sent a rejection email. Never saw it. I had been checking my spam filter too. HR could have been much nicer about the let down.

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Lake Health (Willoughby, OH) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: A friend of mine offerred $5000 referral bonus for a Nurse Practitioner.  She forwarded her email to me, and I subsequently emailed HR department about the job.  HR department emailed back right away, I sent resume and completed online application.  Interviewed 1:1 with Practice Manager, then the physician, and finally the HR people and offer was made.
Interview Questions: What do you already know about the position?
